website_summaries.verdict: This low-stress handwriting bundle is designed to reduce frustrations while learning to print.
pros: Focuses on printing but includes some language arts activities
All-in-one bundle that includes teaching and work materials
Includes punctuation and standard English conventions
cons: Some may want more instruction from the publisher

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention to pictures on the front!!
customer_reviews.text: Pay attention to the pictures on the front. It determines what book you are getting. There are two different books that are the same color. Super confusing!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Learning Without Tears!
customer_reviews.text: This book has been great for us. Penmanship is an easily overlooked skill, but this book makes it fun and easy. If you’re going to go to the trouble to teach your kids to be savvy test takers and articulate writers, why not make them legible too? The illustrations and paper quality are also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: adie

customer_reviews.title: More than a printing book
customer_reviews.text: My child has made an unbelievable amount of progress in the area of handwriting by using this book. I also really like that the book includes educational information, such as about punctuation and continents, to use during the printing practice. I like this because it enables children to practice printing while reinforcing educational concepts rather than mindlessly copying words.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Great for homeschoolers or extra practice!
customer_reviews.text: I love this curriculum! I have used it so far for homeschooling for 2 of my children and it has improved their handwriting skills immensely. It is a steady paced book and allows the kids to practice slowly and the visual aspect of it is great for visual learners!
customer_reviews.author: Thirtysix

customer_reviews.title: No tears and improved writing are wins for me!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these books last year in my homeschool and really liked them. At the beginning of the year I thought I would try doing copywork but my kids were overwhelmed and did cry. I went back to these books and no tears and their handwriting improves so much. I am sold!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamalilia

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Half way through the book and my son has already made great progress with his writing. I like how the book isn't too busy with color and pictures as other books I've purchased in the past. Definitely reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: C wasi

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been using these at home because handwriting is no longer a skill taught at school. Great tool for at home.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: Rip Off
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very thick book for the price. I'm returning it without using it because there's no way it's worth that much.
customer_reviews.author: lime

customer_reviews.title: Great Workbook!
customer_reviews.text: Writing Without Tears is one of our favorite workbook series! We homeschool and this series has given us a lot of headway teaching our youngest to write.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: My 8 yrs old really loves this book. He had really messy handwriting and I realized that something need to done. Then, I talk to my friends and this was recommended. since that day I don’t have to worry about his handwriting. Really recommend this work book for others who are struggling with handwriting. One page a day work best with kids.
customer_reviews.author: lila

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great teaching book, my daughter's writing is looking so much better now.
customer_reviews.author: ABell

customer_reviews.title: You Won't Regret It!!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter couldn't wait to begin practicing. Very easy to follow not stressful at all. Handwriting improving in short span of time.
customer_reviews.author: robin hughes

customer_reviews.title: Good product, condition not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Teacher's Guide had sustained some water damage prior to receipt which was disappointing, but otherwise seems usable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. It helps my left-handed homeschooler with neatness and the strength to hold a pencil longer
customer_reviews.author: Mindy Moore

customer_reviews.title: This is exactly what we wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for another handwriting book to use in our classrooms and this is it!
customer_reviews.author: K Tokuyama

customer_reviews.title: Good for homeschooling little ones!
customer_reviews.text: First 20 pages are a repeat of the yellow book otherwise great for working on handwriting.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Rishmawi

customer_reviews.title: The online program that goes with the book is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It is impossible to use use the updated book as it is meant to be taught without the online program. They have a free trial, check out the online program that goes with it before you buy the book! Awesome for children with dyslexia because it has video’s and steps that help with letter reversal. Otherwise this workbook is just another handwriting notebook. Might as well print off free pages of copy work on the internet! The teacher manual is also useless if you don’t have the online program. Happy handwriting!
customer_reviews.author: itsallbootleg
